poem:
London's Streets  

Amidst the fog,  
all voices converge—  
each faith a thread  
woven in the tapestry  
of bustling streets,  
defying the harshness  
of splintered minds.  

Even as shadows  
threaten to spread,  
we gather,  
a thousand quiet lights  
dissolving darkness—  
resolute in  
togetherness.
